intro: Senecio lopez-mirandae, commonly known as the Lopez-Miranda groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It features narrow, linear leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
